body_html:
Sorry, my fault.

I was testing in Jupyter Notebook and forgot that it added additional complexity to "vanilla" python. So there's no such problem in the python shell.

This problem gradually builds up with each "Kernel Restart". May be it's related to lazy deallocation of memory or maybe it has another reason. Anyway hard restart of Jupyter Notebook cleans out this problem.

So I don't see anything wrong on PyTorch side here.

UPDATE:
Correction - the problem is "Variable Inspector" plugin.

body:
Sorry, my fault. 

I was testing in Jupyter Notebook and forgot that it added additional complexity to "vanilla" python. So there's no such problem in the python shell.

This problem gradually builds up with each "Kernel Restart". May be it's related to lazy deallocation of memory or maybe it has another reason. Anyway hard restart of Jupyter Notebook cleans out this problem.

So I don't see anything wrong on PyTorch side here.

UPDATE:
Correction - the problem is "Variable Inspector" plugin.
